SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am49.client.sockets

Class SocketHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am49.client.sockets.SocketHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
ServerSocketHandler
public class SocketHandler extends Object
The SocketHandler class is responsible for managing socket communication between the client and the server. It handles the creation of socket connections, sending and receiving messages, and managing the lifecycle of the socket connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • SocketHandler

      public SocketHandler(String host, int port) throws IOException
      Constructs a SocketHandler with the specified host and port.
      Parameters:
      host - the host to connect to
      port - the port to connect to
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket

    • SocketHandler

      public SocketHandler(Socket socket) throws IOException
      Constructs a SocketHandler with an existing socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - the existing socket
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the input/output streams

  • Method Details

    • startListeningForMessages

      public void startListeningForMessages() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Starts listening for messages from the socket.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from the input stream
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found

    • sendRequest

      public <T> T sendRequest(SocketMessage request, Class<T> responseType) throws Exception
      Sends a request to the server and waits for a response.
      Parameters:
      request - the request message to send
      responseType - the expected type of the response
      Returns:
      the response from the server
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while sending the request or waiting for the response

    • handlePushMessage

      protected void handlePushMessage(SocketMessage msg)
      Handles push messages received from the socket.
      Parameters:
      msg - the push message to handle

    • getUniqueId

      public int getUniqueId()
      Returns a unique identifier to be used for a new message to the socket. When sending the message with the return value, the other party will need to attach the generated unique identifier.
      Returns:
      a unique identifier

    • close

      public void close()
